intro: Omphalodes runemarkii, commonly known as the purple rock cress, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with small, four-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, where it thrives in well-drained soils and full sun exposure. Its flowers are usually purple or violet in color, with a distinctive arrangement of petals and sepals. Omphalodes runemarkii is characterized by its compact growth habit and is often found in high-altitude habitats.
